title: Blood Volume Calculation
description: Calculates total blood volume, red blood cell volume, and plasma volume using Nadler equations based on age, sex, height, weight, and hematocrit

parameters.name: patient_category
parameters.description: Patient age/weight category determining calculation method
options: adult_or_child_25kg_plus - Adult or child ≥25 kg (Nadler equations)

parameters.name: sex
parameters.description: Patient sex (required for adults/children ≥25 kg using Nadler equations)

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Patient height in centimeters (required for adults/children ≥25 kg using Nadler equations)

parameters.name: hematocrit
parameters.description: Hematocrit percentage (optional, needed for RBC and plasma volume calculations)

result.name: blood_volumes
result.description: Calculated blood volumes including total, RBC, and plasma volumes

ranges.interpretation: Blood volume calculations provide estimates for clinical decision-making including transfusion therapy, plasma exchange, and drug dosing. Total blood volume is calculated using established equations. RBC and plasma volumes require hematocrit input.

references: Nadler SB, Hidalgo JH, Bloch T. Prediction of blood volume in normal human adults. Surgery. 1962 Feb;51(2):224-32.
Gilcher RO, McCombs JS. Blood volume and red cell mass measurements. In: Hillman RS, Ault KA, Rinder HM, editors. Hematology in Clinical Practice. 4th ed. New York: McGraw-Hill; 2005. p. 595-605.
International Council for Standardization in Haematology. Recommended methods for measurement of red-cell and plasma volume. J Nucl Med. 1980 Aug;21(8):793-800.
formula: Total Blood Volume: Adults/children ≥25kg use Nadler equations: Male=[0.3669×height³+0.03219×weight+0.6041], Female=[0.3561×height³+0.03308×weight+0.1833]. Children <25kg use weight-based: Preterm neonate=100mL/kg, Term neonate=85mL/kg, Infant=75mL/kg, Child=70mL/kg. RBC Volume=Total×(Hct/100). Plasma Volume=Total×(1-Hct/100)
notes: Developed by Nadler et al. in 1962 based on radioisotope labeling studies
Nadler equations apply to adults and children ≥25 kg using height, weight, and sex
Weight-based calculations (mL/kg) used for children <25 kg
Preterm neonates: 100 mL/kg, Term neonates: 85 mL/kg
Infants 1-4 months: 75 mL/kg, Children <25 kg: 70 mL/kg
Height must be converted to meters for Nadler equation calculations
Hematocrit is optional but required for RBC and plasma volume calculations
Clinical applications include transfusion therapy, plasma exchange, and coagulation factor dosing
Less accurate in obese patients due to non-linear relationship with weight
Results guide blood product dosing, fluid management, and therapeutic procedures
Normal blood volume is approximately 70 mL/kg for males, 65 mL/kg for females
Calculations assume normal hydration status and absence of acute blood loss
